TextBody:
Hello Jean-Christophe,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00435746. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00435746
Ticket Subject: positioning of user rights (viewer) on domain.
Ticket Details: Managing a new domain requires assigning roles to users individually. Is there a more efficient method to assign roles to multiple users across one or more domains simultaneously?

Thank you!

Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

Hi Jean,

Thanks for your response.

Let’s set up a meeting once you have some time to go into this. Let me know when you'd be available to discuss this further.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer

I haven't taken the time to go into this.

But if you develop an API to enable the viewer role for several users on a domain, I'm interested.

 

Best regards.

Hello Jean-Christophe, I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00435746. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue. If you’re still experiencing problems



 


Hello Jean-Christophe,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00435746. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00435746
Ticket Subject: positioning of user rights (viewer) on domain.
Ticket Details: We need to take over the management of a new domain, which requires assigning the correct roles to users individually. Is there a more efficient method to assign roles to multiple users across one or more domains simultaneously?

Thank you!

Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Netwrix Support [techsupport@netwrix.com]
Sent: 2/14/2025 8:41 AM
To: jean-christophe.perez-galiano@external.engie.com
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #435746 - - positioning of user rights (viewer) on domain. [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0LqJVi:ref ]

Hi Jean,

Thank you for provided details.

The recommended approach would be to use claims-based authentication. This allows you to manage user access efficiently by:


	Creating a group (either in Active Directory for Windows Authentication or in your Identity Provider for SAML/OpenID Connect).
	Adding the necessary users to this group.
	Granting access to the group directly within the console.


However, if you wish to use the API, you will need to:


	Create the users,
	Retrieve all domains that the users need access to,
	And then grant the necessary authorization through the API.


Another way would be to create the permissions on an entity and assign the domains to said entity.

Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
____________________ _________
Powerful Data Security Made Easy

300 Spectrum Ctr Dr #200, Irvine, CA 92618
www.netwrix.com

Hi Jean, My name is Iulia and I am happy to assist you today. To address the need for assigning roles to multiple users across one or more domains efficiently, we recommend using claims-based permissions in combination with an Identity Provider



 


Hi Jean,

My name is Iulia and I am happy to assist you today.

To address the need for assigning roles to multiple users across one or more domains efficiently, we recommend using claims-based permissions in combination with an Identity Provider (IdP) or Windows Authentication to control access.

This approach will streamline user role management and reduce the need for manual assignments.

Please let us know if you need further assistance or additional details.

Best regards,
Iulia Apatachioaei
Sr. Support Engineer
